events.text: Enough talk.

events.choice: How did you know Thoroughbred was dead? Nobody's put out a report on it, yet.

events.text: As I was just telling your esteemed colleague, I go to a lot of trouble to keep well-informed, especially on the whereabouts of my internet cohorts. I heard about a crime scene at Yung Dab's estate, put in a few calls, and heard the awful news.
So you've got friends on the force.
I'm a law-abiding citizen, John Souls. All the police are my friends.

And here I thought I was a bad liar. I had to hand it to him, I'd pounded pavement and turned every lead upside down, but I never found a damn thing on Chugs.		
For all I know, the man might be completely clean. I knew he was completely shaved, at least. Manscape must pay well, with those kinds of suits.
Like I said, I keep well-informed. But for something this big, I just had to see it myself.
Word is you didn't like Yung Dab very much.
I wouldn't go that far. We had our... professional disagreements.
I wanted to get out of here, and bad. But this was the third YouTuber connected somehow to Dab, and the gumshoe in me just couldn't resist.
Care to elaborate?
The kingpin thought for a moment, and then spoke.
I don't see why not, Mr. Souls. I'm not a man who feels a need to keep secrets.
Normally I'd scoff at that. But the man rapped about shaving his own balls. I hate to say it, but it tracked.
You see Mr. Souls, Yung Dab approached me about getting early access to my videos before they went live. Said he could make it worth my while, said there was a market for it.
A market?

I had no clue what he was rambling about, and I declined. I'm a man of the people, Mr. Souls. All my subscribers can witness my productions and achievements the moment they finish uploading. No early access, besides my editors, of course. Complete equality. But Yung Dab pressed the matter.
And your response?
I told him if he asked again, I'd have him chugging a glass boot without anything in it.
I raised an eyebrow, impressed. Not many men had the cleanly shaven stones to say that to somebody like Maximilian Thoroughbred.
Funny, you seemed like the kind of man who would take any business opportunity that came his way.
A flash of anger crossed Chugs face, the jolly veneer stripped away. Like the sweetness of a soda chug that gave way to the raging carbonation beneath.
He insulted my HONOR, John Souls. Thought he could buy access to my videos, thought I'd take a quick dollar in exchange for my ethics.
No offense Chugs, but you do Manscaping sponsorships and then chug tubs of mayonaise. What does the state of your ballsack have to do with ethics?
The state of my ballsack be damned! I use and promote those products because they are HIGH QUALITY! A man has his PRINCIPLES, John Souls. And anybody who questions mine gets...
His jowls quivered and his eyes narrowed viciously, giving me a glimpse of the man that rose to the top of the cutthroat world of food YouTube.
The boot.
His posture became stiff.
Enough talk.
That's all for now, Chugs.
